result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donterris Montrell Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.
Original Information previously filed on 5/05/15 contains an additional charge listed as COUNT 2. COUNT 2 added into CCAP. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Parties have reached a global resolution with defendant's other pending case (15CF878). Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter today. Parties request a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Donterris Montrell Robinson in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
